alert.note: Alert for Western Grant (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 3:50AM EST until January 14 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with locally higher amounts up to 5 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Western Grant County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 11 AM EST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 AM Sunday to 4 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers increase in coverage and intensity tonight, and continue through this morning. Snow squalls are most likely between 5 AM and 10 AM, producing additional snow accumulations, blowing snow, and near zero visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
